10.text:

Trap, and we're going to look

12.text:
at it's fantastic adaptation, so it will link

18.text:
The Venus Fly Trap's got a particularly extreme
adaptation where it's modified

23.text:
its leaves into these leaves that close and
trap flies.

26.text:
The investigation is all about working out
if these plants can count

31.text: and how they sense the flies in the trap.

34.text:
As you can probably see, there are hairs around
the outside of the traps.

39.text:
These aren't actually the triggers that trigger
off the trap to close.

43.text:
There's much smaller hairs on the inside of
the trap

47.text:
and what you can get your students to do
is to work out by using a forcep or a pencil

52.text:
which hairs it is that cause the trap to close
If you get them to do the outer hairs, and

58.text: tap it once, you'll find nothing happens.

61.text:
If they do the inner hairs and tap once, nothing
will happen.

66.text:
But if you do two taps to the inner hair in
close succession - so two taps

73.text:
within 15 seconds - you'll find that the trap
closes

78.text: because it needs that number of taps to close.
